meanings.definition: Relating to the production, distribution, and consumption of goods and services.
meanings.sent1: The company made an economic decision to increase production.
meanings.sent2: The economic impact of the new policy was significant.
meanings.sent3: It was an economic choice to buy the cheaper brand of cereal.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to time management was like an economic strategy.
meanings.sent5: The economic principles taught in class were easy to understand.

meanings.definition: Concerned with the efficient use of resources.
meanings.sent1: Using a timer for laundry is an economic way to save energy.
meanings.sent2: The farmer implemented economic irrigation methods to conserve water.
meanings.sent3: She had an economic plan to organize her closet efficiently.
meanings.sent4: His mind worked like an economic machine, always finding the most efficient solution.
meanings.sent5: The economic use of space in the tiny apartment was impressive.

meanings.definition: Involving financial matters or the economy.
meanings.sent1: The economic forecast predicted a rise in inflation.
meanings.sent2: The economic crisis led to job losses across the country.
meanings.sent3: He had an economic approach to budgeting his allowance.
meanings.sent4: Her investment strategy was like an economic puzzle, carefully planned out.
meanings.sent5: The economic discussions at the conference were enlightening.
